# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line_length = 0
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        wrapped_text *= (line_length == 0 ? "" : " ") * word
        line_length += length(word) + (line_length == 0 ? 0 : 1)
    end

    return wrapped_text
end

# Example
text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This function `wrap_string` takes a `String` and a `text_width` with a default value of 10. It wraps the text such that each line does not exceed the specified width, considering spaces between words and preferring to break lines between words rather than cutting them off.
